intro: Gymnosporia condensata, commonly known as the dense-fruited burr bush, is a shrub native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its spiny stems and small, dense clusters of fruit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by woody, spherical fruits. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a leathery texture. Gymnosporia condensata is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
